author: Sharad Vyas
text:
The Maharashtra government has planned a comprehensive street and building art branding campaign to promote Mumbai during the ‘Make in India Week’ beginning February 13.

The branding campaign, which will include art, murals, electronic display and colourful wraps around buildings, has been approved by the Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion, Government of India. It will have a Bollywood-style theme and also include special designs that promote the Indian growth story in five sectors, including space research, automobile and Information Technology (IT).

The government has invoked special provisions of the law to get speedy permission and fund approval from the local implementing agencies. An exemption under Section 72(3) of the Mumbai Municipal Corporation (MMC) Act has been given to the Make in India Week for speedy approvals of funds and permissions at the level of the local corporation.

Nearly 4,000 delegates from over 50 countries are expected to attend the event where the government is expecting to sign vital MoUs with leading global CEOs and corporates. The street art and mural campaign will be carried out at five locations at a cost of Rs 50 lakh.

The area to be covered by these murals across the city is 5,030 feet. “These murals will showcase economic progress of India in various sectors in which the government is likely to sign agreements with foreign delegates,” said Ranjit Dahiya of the Bombay Art Project (BAP), an urban spaces art firm.

Special murals planned to showcase economic progress of India in various sectors
title: Make in India to get Bollywood branding
